intro: Corydalis cashmeriana var. longicalcarata, commonly known as the long-beaked corydalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Native to the Himalayas, it thrives in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its unique floral structure and ornamental value make it a sought-after species in botanical gardens and among plant enthusiasts.
